alert.note: Alert for Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 11 at 2:47PM CDT until September 16 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Pecatonica River at Freeport affecting Stephenson County. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Pecatonica River at Freeport. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet, Numerous streets are closed north and south of Illinois Highway 75 and water enters the first floor level of a few homes. Water also begins to enter Taylor Park. Businesses along Van Buren Street north of the Pecatonica River are directly affected by water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 5.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
